image.altText: a car that has been in an accident

items.synopsis: A 58-year-old woman, who police say tested positive to methamphetamine, has been arrested after a three-car crash in Adelaide's southern suburbs this afternoon.

title.children: Police say woman who tested positive to methamphetamine has caused major peak hour traffic delays

image.altText: A mother and father with a child in a wheelchair, and another child on a swing.

items.synopsis: Barely two months ago, Spencer Barton was an active and energetic five-year-old — but a shock diagnosis has turned the lives of him and his parents upside down, and left them battling not only his condition but the health system.

title.children: 5yo's 'truly heartbreaking' health battle leaves his family struggling to secure support

image.altText: A building site

items.synopsis: South Australian builder Qattro has been placed into liquidation, leaving more than 200 homes unfinished.

title.children: Construction of hundreds of homes in limbo after another SA builder collapses

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

items.synopsis: An Adelaide man accused of importing and producing child-like dolls at his Elizabeth Downs family home has been denied bail.

title.children: Man intercepted by Australian Federal Police allegedly importing child-like dolls denied bail

image.altText: A woman with a ponytail and dark long sleeve top standing in front of a tree

items.synopsis: An expert says there's been a spike in pneumonia infections in people with healthy immune systems. Circus performer Caitlyn Larsson, who had the infection for three months this year, is one of them.

title.children: Why are even healthy people getting sick with pneumonia this year?

image.altText: A man stands on a balcony with a frown on his face.

items.synopsis: Insurance companies have responded to back-to-back floods and soaring building costs by hiking premiums by around 30 per cent in just one year. But for the riskiest homes, cover is either refused outright, or offered at prices few can afford.

title.children: 'Who can afford that?' Scott was quoted nearly $32K for home and contents insurance as premiums soar

image.altText: An elderly woman holds up a small poster that reads 'vote no', as part of a rally for the Indigenous Voice to Parliament.

items.synopsis: The No campaign has been accused of asking volunteers to spread "fear and misinformation" in an effort to convince referendum voters of its agenda.

title.children: Voice No campaign accused of asking volunteers to 'flat out lie'

image.altText: Angus Brayshaw is lying on a stretcher with a neck brace on and his eyes closed

items.synopsis: As Collingwood defender Brayden Maynard prepares to face the tribunal for his hit on Melbourne's Angus Brayshaw, the rest of the league awaits a verdict which some believe could shape the future of the game.

title.children: 'The whole footy world will be watching': Maynard verdict predicted to shape the future of footy

image.altText: A view from above shows flooding.

items.synopsis: More than 70 crocodiles have reportedly escaped from a farm in the Guangdong province after days of relentless rain following former Typhoon Haiku.

title.children: Seven people die, more than 70 crocodiles reportedly escape amid flooding in China

image.altText: A WA Police badge on an officer's shirt shoulder.

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the suicide of a young WA Police officer explores why he was able to access his police firearm at home.

title.children: Police officer who took his own life hid mental health issues at work, had gun at home, inquest told

items.synopsis: The Mediterranean storm has claimed another 2,000 lives and left vast areas of Libya underwater. Here's what we know about why it was so powerful, and the extent of the devastation.

title.children: First it was Greece, now it's Libya. Why was Storm Daniel so deadly?

image.altText: A pharmacist standing behind a counter holding a prescription basket towards the camera

items.synopsis: Parents and carers are warned that a shortage affecting the most-prescribed antibiotics for children is set to continue until early next year.

title.children: The most-prescribed antibiotics for children are in critically short supply across the country

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un waves from a private train.

items.synopsis: Kim Jong Un's trip to Russia by rail has drawn attention to the traditional method of travel for North Korean leaders — luxury, armoured trains that have long been a part of the dynasty's lore.

title.children: Kim Jong Un has arrived in Russia by rail. Here's a look at his luxury armoured train

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

items.synopsis: After months of negotiations, the government’s signature housing promise is set to pass the Senate. So how many new homes will be built, how soon, and where across the country?

title.children: Where will these new homes be built? Here's what the government's new housing bill means for you

image.altText: An old house with a red tin roof and white exterior sits on a property behind a wooden fence.

items.synopsis: A NSW court hears that three trucks were required to transport items allegedly stolen by Mark Ian Anderson after they were seized by police.

title.children: Man accused of stealing more than 1,000 items from museums over 9 years denied bail

image.altText: Cass Whitehill looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: Cass Whitehill says staff at the Royal Hobart Hospital failed to realise she had potentially fatal blood clots in her lungs, despite hospital tests detecting them.

title.children: Trainee nurse claims she was left with two 'ticking time bombs' in her lungs after visit to hospital

image.altText: A white man with short hair walks on a footpath in front of cars, wearing a suit, tie and dark glasses.

items.synopsis: Adam Green admits placing 1,170 bets on fixed matches in Ukraine from his Newcastle home.

title.children: Former Australian table tennis player avoids jail over $473K won on rigged matches

image.altText: A woman in a formal red dress stands in front of a lectern, with blue curtains behind her.

items.synopsis: Australia's new sex discrimination commissioner says she's appalled to hear former Coalition cabinet minister, Karen Andrews's accusations of harassment.

title.children: 'Appals me': Sex discrimination commissioner appalled to hear of Karen Andrews harassment allegations

image.altText: A pregnant woman in a white dress with a horse on a beach.

items.synopsis: Emma Goyne believes she picked up the parasitic infection while cleaning her horse stable, which a neighbouring cat had been using as a litter box. Now she's pushing for tougher cat laws.

title.children: 'Cat poo on my hands': Emma fell sick when pregnant. She wants cat laws tightened

image.altText: A young man wearing a grey hoodie.

items.synopsis: A boy who repeatedly stabbed "typical, cheeky teenager" Declan Cutler during a deadly gang attack on a Melbourne street is jailed for 15 years.

title.children: Teens jailed over 'savage and totally unprovoked' fatal attack on Melbourne 16yo

image.altText: The sun sets over Kakadu National Park.

items.synopsis: The Gundjeihmi Aboriginal Corporation says a "great burden has been removed" after ORIC confirmed the end of its long-running investigation, with no findings made and no actions to be taken.

title.children: Years-long investigation dropped into Aboriginal corporation representing Kakadu TOs

image.altText: Protesters outside South Australia's parliament during a teachers' strike.

items.synopsis: Education Minister Blair Boyer says the government provided the Australian Education Union (AEU) with a revised offer of more than $1.3 billion following two meetings with union representatives last week.

title.children: SA public school teachers cancel planned strike action after revised government offer

image.altText: An AFL player in a black training shirt, catches a football

items.synopsis: Maynard's season will be over if Collingwood is unable to throw out the defender's ban for rough conduct. Follow live.

title.children: 'Inherently dangerous': AFL counsel takes aim as Pies' star Brayden Maynard fights for his season at tribunal

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Chair Jeff Gleeson talks about the instructions for panels in looking at cases, particularly given that the case has involved repeated viewings of slowed-down footage, multiple angles and still frames. He says the panel is "acutely aware" that such vision and stills can sometimes distort the reality of events, and that can give an impression of an action or actions that does not match reality. Chair Gleeson says he makes no apology whatsoever for the fact the hearing has taken three hours. He also warns that any decision flowing from the panel's deliberations will not mark a "key event" in relation to the definition or understanding of duty of care for players, saying that it will apply to the specific circumstances of the case. Chair Gleeson adjourns the hearing, and deliberations will begin.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Chair Jeff Gleeson adjourns the hearing so deliberations can begin

children.content: Chair Jeff Gleeson talks about the instructions for panels in looking at cases, particularly given that the case has involved repeated viewings of slowed-down footage, multiple angles and still frames.
He says the panel is "acutely aware" that such vision and stills can sometimes distort the reality of events, and that can give an impression of an action or actions that does not match reality.
Chair Gleeson says he makes no apology whatsoever for the fact the hearing has taken three hours.

He also warns that any decision flowing from the panel's deliberations will not mark a "key event" in relation to the definition or understanding of duty of care for players, saying that it will apply to the specific circumstances of the case.
Chair Gleeson adjourns the hearing, and deliberations will begin.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Ihle finishes up his submissions, saying the panel should find: "This was unfortunate, this was an accident but this was not unreasonable conduct on Mr Maynard's part. I respectfully ask that you dismiss the charge."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Ihle calls for charge to be dismissed

children.content: Ihle finishes up his submissions, saying the panel should find:
"This was unfortunate, this was an accident but this was not unreasonable conduct on Mr Maynard's part. I respectfully ask that you dismiss the charge."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Ihle returns to Maynard's evidence about flinching before the impact. "He flinched, he told you that he flinched, the footage shows movement consistently with a flinch ... moving his head out of the way," he says. "That's all he could have done, that's all any of us could do in a couple of hundred milliseconds." Ihle says AFL is a high-velocity game, played at speed. "Just because we can point to other things he could have done that were reasonable, doesn't mean that what he did was unreasonable." He adds that the case risks becoming "so heavily encrusted with hindsight bias that it doesn't do justice to the realities of playing our game."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Flinching 'all he could have done', says Maynard's counsel

children.content: Ihle returns to Maynard's evidence about flinching before the impact.
"He flinched, he told you that he flinched, the footage shows movement consistently with a flinch ... moving his head out of the way," he says.
"That's all he could have done, that's all any of us could do in a couple of hundred milliseconds."
Ihle says AFL is a high-velocity game, played at speed.
"Just because we can point to other things he could have done that were reasonable, doesn't mean that what he did was unreasonable."
He adds that the case risks becoming "so heavily encrusted with hindsight bias that it doesn't do justice to the realities of playing our game."

image.altText: A tractor with a sign that reads 'No Waste Dump' is parked in a wheat field. A rainbow is in the sky.

items.synopsis: Resources Minister Madeleine King says the Commonwealth had spent $108.6 million towards establishing the National Radioactive Waste Management Facility (NRWMF) between July 2014 and August 2023.

title.children: Federal government reveals cost of abandoned nuclear waste dump in South Australia

image.altText: A middle-aged, bespectacled man in a suit exits a court building.

items.synopsis: Maurice Molan will be fined $2,500 after pleading guilty to misconduct in public office over the 2013 engagement of an allegedly fraudulent third-party training company.

title.children: Former executive avoids conviction over $1.8m TAFE scandal

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for the 32-year-old accused of stealing Nick Kyrgios's Tesla say police are taking too long to hand over the full brief of evidence and the case should be abandoned.

title.children: Canberra man accused of stealing Nick Kyrgios's Tesla wants case against him to be dropped

image.altText: An aerial view shows the charred remains of a building, with sparse trees nearby

items.synopsis: With a seemingly endless supply of guns, money and young men willing to act as mercenaries, tribal fighting in PNG has become akin to guerilla warfare.

title.children: Violence is so bad in this PNG community that police sealed it off to outsiders. The ABC got to go inside

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

items.synopsis: Detectives appeal for information after a man allegedly approached a 12-year-old girl in Warnbro on Monday and grabbed her shirt before she managed to escape.

title.children: Police investigating reports of alleged attempted child abduction in Perth's southern suburbs

image.altText: An adult emu and four chicks cross a road in an outback town.

items.synopsis: The 23-year-old was issued a $619 infringement notice for driving without due care and attention following the incident in Longreach.

title.children: Woman fined over emu chick deaths in outback town following road incident

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: Two tourism companies on trial over the deadly Whakaari White Island volcano eruption have had charges dismissed.

title.children: More White Island tourism companies have charges dismissed, just one defendant remains

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

items.synopsis: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has increased her stake in lithium firm Liontown Resources as global lithium giant Albemarle seeks a buyout. Meanwhile, the ASX rose for the second day in a row.

title.children: Gina Rinehart ups stake in lithium miner Liontown Resources in looming takeover battle, ASX closes higher, consumer confidence — as it happened

image.altText: A man of Asian appearance wears glasses and stands speaking at a podium in a room, in front of a chalkboard and computer screens

items.synopsis: Banned from Australia over an alleged foreign interference plot in New South Wales, Chen Hong maintains he has done nothing wrong and continues to criticise the diplomatic stance taken by the former Coalition government.

title.children: Chinese scholar barred from Australia takes part in high-level dialogue between nations in Beijing

image.altText: A woman voting at night at a cardboard polling booth

items.synopsis: The governor-general has issued the writ for the Voice to Parliament referendum, setting in motion the time line for the nationwide vote.

title.children: Voice referendum key dates for postal and early votes have been confirmed. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: a truck on a highway covered in smoke

items.synopsis: Acting NT Chief Minister Nicole Manison says the next 24 to 48 hours would be a "critical" time, with a predicted wind change expected to push the fire towards the town.

title.children: Emergency declaration called for Tennant Creek with bushfire risk to increase from tomorrow

image.altText: Female migrant worker pictured at plastic manufacturing factory

items.synopsis: Nooria Hashimi could never imagine buying her own home and having a steady income. Now the migrant worker has a full-time job at a plastics manufacturing factory, with the goal to one day owning her own house.

title.children: 'Working helps': Female migrant workers share how having a job empowered them
